body.html: If your employer provides a 401(k) retirement plan with matched contributions, what percent of your income would you need to contribute to maximize the employer match?

A 401(k) is a tax-advantaged retirement account, and employers often ‘match’ employee contributions up to a specified percentage of income. An employer match is a guaranteed return on investment, so this is a very high financial priority! For this question, if your employer provides a contribution match up to 6% of your income, you should enter 6 in the box. If your employer does not match 401(k) contributions, leave this box blank.
